intro: Euanthe, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in the southwestern United States and Mexico. Euanthe species typically grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss.
